sentence.Network_en: There was a slackening of western output during the 1930s.
sentence.Network_cn: 20世纪30年代西部的产出有所减少。

sentence.Network_en: Wang replied without slackening his pace.
sentence.Network_cn: 王三毛一边回答,一边只顾走.

sentence.Network_en: Indeed, its idea was slackening in New England by the early eighteeth century.
sentence.Network_cn: 其实, 到了十八世纪初,控制新英格兰的这种思想已有所减弱.

PerfectNetExp.abs: Is there going to be slackening again after May I ?, 五月一日以后 , 是不是又要缓和一下呢?
The signs of China ' s slackening demand are manifold ., 中国需求走软的迹象是多方面的.
slackening 削弱, slackening 行情疲跌, slackening 放慢
slacken 怠惰, slackening 使变松弛, slacken 拧松

list.abs: The runners slackened their pace ., 赛跑者放慢了步子.
slacken discipline ; afraid that morale might slacken ., 放松纪律 ; 害怕士气会松懈.
slacken discipline ; afraid that morale might slacken ., 放松纪律 ; 害怕士气会松懈.

entry.def: If something slackens or if you slacken it, it becomes slower, less active, or less intense.

example.ex: Inflationary pressures continued to slacken last month...
example.tran: 上个月，通货膨胀的压力继续减小。

example.ex: The Conservative government will not slacken the pace of radical reform.
example.tran: 保守党政府不会放慢激进改革的步伐。

entry.def: If your grip or a part of your body slackens or if you slacken your grip, it becomes looser or more relaxed.

example.ex: Her grip slackened on Arnold's arm...
example.tran: 她紧握着阿诺德的手松开了。

example.ex: Muscles stretch, slacken and relax during childbirth.
example.tran: 生孩子的时候，肌肉会拉抻、放松，然后松弛下来。

means.word_mean: 1. an occurrence of control or strength weakening;

auth_sentence.content: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perceptible slackening of the taut muscles of his mouth.

auth_sentence.content: But as time went on she began to believe in her invention, and became terrified of any sign of slackening of effort.
auth_sentence.res_content: But as time went on she began to believe in her invention, and became terrified of any sign of slackening of effort.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But as time went on she began to believe in her invention, and became terrified of any sign of slackening of effort.

auth_sentence.content: Dr. Nagaraj went vague, his face slackening, then, "Oh, yes," as he pretended to remember what he'd been saying.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dr. Nagaraj went vague, his face slackening, then, "Oh, yes," as he pretended to remember what he'd been saying.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dr. Nagaraj went vague, his face slackening, then, "Oh, yes," as he pretended to remember what he'd been saying.
